turn.text: In this case, the manufacturer says they own the machines until they're paid for in full.
The machine was not paid for in full.

turn.speaker: anthony_m_kennedy
turn.label: Justice Anthony M. Kennedy
turn.text: I'm -- I'm -- I'm trying to relate what happened here to the Internet hypothetical.
I have the--

turn.speaker: alexander_w_ross_jr
turn.label: Mr. Alexander W. Ross Jr.
turn.text: Right.

turn.speaker: anthony_m_kennedy
turn.label: Justice Anthony M. Kennedy
turn.text: --Internet hypothetical where there's just an advertisement.

turn.speaker: alexander_w_ross_jr
turn.label: Mr. Alexander W. Ross Jr.
turn.text: Right.

turn.speaker: anthony_m_kennedy
turn.label: Justice Anthony M. Kennedy
turn.text: And at first I thought you were saying that's sufficient.
Now you're say, no, because they have to be part of the contract.
I'm trying to make the Internet equivalent to the trade show.

turn.speaker: alexander_w_ross_jr
turn.label: Mr. Alexander W. Ross Jr.
turn.text: If the Internet web site is interactive, so you can sit in New Jersey, order the product, complete the transaction, send money, and in response to the money coming, you get a product--

turn.speaker: anthony_m_kennedy
turn.label: Justice Anthony M. Kennedy
turn.text: Not just an advertisement?

turn.speaker: alexander_w_ross_jr
turn.label: Mr. Alexander W. Ross Jr.
turn.text: --Not just an advertisement.

turn.speaker: anthony_m_kennedy
turn.label: Justice Anthony M. Kennedy
turn.text: Even though that's the cause for the buyer's interest in it and he pursues -- pursues his -- his transaction after finding out all the information on the Internet from an Ohio distributor?

turn.speaker: alexander_w_ross_jr
turn.label: Mr. Alexander W. Ross Jr.
turn.text: It's not enough, in my judgment, if -- under the Internet example that you just gave.

If there's an interactive web site where the person in New Jersey can press buttons on his computer and complete the transaction with the result that the product comes to New Jersey, under those circumstances, I would say there is--

turn.speaker: john_g_roberts_jr
turn.label: Chief Justice John G. Roberts, Jr.
turn.text: Complete?
It's got to complete the transaction?

turn.speaker: alexander_w_ross_jr
turn.label: Mr. Alexander W. Ross Jr.
turn.text: --That's correct.

turn.speaker: john_g_roberts_jr
turn.label: Chief Justice John G. Roberts, Jr.
turn.text: What if it's -- you know, punch these numbers and we will send you an application for a machine, is that not enough, because he's got to complete the transaction?

turn.speaker: alexander_w_ross_jr
turn.label: Mr. Alexander W. Ross Jr.
turn.text: I would say under those circumstances, that that's part of what the manufacturer requires, but the end result is that the machine winds up in New Jersey through this contact between the person and the manufacturer, then I would say that would be enough for jurisdiction.

turn.speaker: john_g_roberts_jr
turn.label: Chief Justice John G. Roberts, Jr.
turn.text: So that if they say, fill this out, and contact this person, McIntyre, whatever, in Ohio, that's where you can get one of our machines, that's enough?

turn.speaker: alexander_w_ross_jr
turn.label: Mr. Alexander W. Ross Jr.
turn.text: I would say in that case they have deliberately targeted the entire United States market, but they want you to go through their distributor, which they have hired--

turn.speaker: john_g_roberts_jr
turn.label: Chief Justice John G. Roberts, Jr.
turn.text: Would their--

turn.speaker: alexander_w_ross_jr
turn.label: Mr. Alexander W. Ross Jr.
turn.text: --in Ohio, and he sends it, it's the same situation.
Well, if there's no further questions, I would simply like to ask this Court to affirm the judgement of the Supreme Court of New Jersey in this case.

turn.speaker: john_g_roberts_jr
turn.label: Chief Justice John G. Roberts, Jr.
turn.text: --Thank you, Mr. Ross.

turn.speaker: alexander_w_ross_jr
turn.label: Mr. Alexander W. Ross Jr.
turn.text: Thank you.

turn.speaker: john_g_roberts_jr
turn.label: Chief Justice John G. Roberts, Jr.
turn.text: Mr. Fergensen, you have two minutes remaining.

turn.speaker: arthur_f_fergenson
turn.label: Mr. Arthur F. Fergenson
turn.text: Thank you, Your Honor.
Justice Breyer, I would -- in response to your concern, I would ask you to look at page 29 of the State's amicus brief.

Ignorance of the fact that New Jersey is a State within our union or of the specifics of New Jersey products liability law should not allow Petitioner to avoid jurisdiction, its own lack of research, prior to embarking on a nationwide marketing campaign is no defense.
I think that--

turn.speaker: sonia_sotomayor
turn.label: Justice Sonia Sotomayor
turn.text: I think--

turn.speaker: elena_kagan
turn.label: Justice Elena Kagan
turn.text: Mr. Fergenson, could I ask you a question?

turn.speaker: sonia_sotomayor
turn.label: Justice Sonia Sotomayor
turn.text: --I'm sorry.
Could you -- just one quick point of clarification.

turn.speaker: arthur_f_fergenson
turn.label: Mr. Arthur F. Fergenson
turn.text: --Yes, Your Honor.

turn.speaker: sonia_sotomayor
turn.label: Justice Sonia Sotomayor
turn.text: It's a point that your adversary raised in passing.
I'm not quite sure, do you sell outright to the American company?
Do you ship a product and they pay you, or they only pay you when they receive the money from their customer?
There appears to be some suggestion of the latter.

turn.speaker: arthur_f_fergenson
turn.label: Mr. Arthur F. Fergenson
turn.text: And the New Jersey Supreme Court said there was a suggestion that some trades could have been by consignment.

I believe that that is outside of this -- taken out of this case by an admission in the brief -- at least for this sale -- in the brief in our position to defendant's motion to dismiss at 1920 filed October 11th, 2006, where they state, where respondent states it was sold by us to MMA, and it was sold by MMA to Curcio Scrap Metal.
So, there is no consignment, there is no consignment under 9102 which Ohio has adopted.

turn.speaker: sonia_sotomayor
turn.label: Justice Sonia Sotomayor
turn.text: It is a different question than I asked.
There was no consignment on this machine?

turn.speaker: arthur_f_fergenson
turn.label: Mr. Arthur F. Fergenson
turn.text: Yes.

turn.speaker: sonia_sotomayor
turn.label: Justice Sonia Sotomayor
turn.text: But you're not claiming that there might not be on others?

turn.speaker: arthur_f_fergenson
turn.label: Mr. Arthur F. Fergenson
turn.text: The evidence in the record under 9102 which Ohio has adopted, I think can only be reasonably viewed -- and this Court obviously treats it as de novo, on a jurisdictional review -- can only be viewed as not a consignment because MMA was in the business of selling the products to others.
Let me say that for the -- there was no interaction in the record with anyone from New Jersey by MMA or by J. McIntyre.
It was the booth, and then there was an order.
And if you look at the invoice, it says verbal order.
There was an order by the son of the owner of Curcio metal works, and that's it.
The order was fulfilled.

turn.speaker: elena_kagan
turn.label: Justice Elena Kagan
turn.text: Mr. Fergenson, Toyota, Honda, Volkswagen -- pick your car company -- sells many millions of cars to the United States.
They start flowing up here, they operate through independent distributors only.
Can they be subject to jurisdiction in any of the States?

turn.speaker: arthur_f_fergenson
turn.label: Mr. Arthur F. Fergenson
turn.text: I think that most sophisticated distribution networks -- and this one was not -- I -- the defense takes it as a -- takes on the issue of this as a scheme.

Most sophisticated distribution networks, such as the manufacturers you're talking about, there is -- there is recourse to remedies throughout the United States, whether against the distributor or against the manufacturer.

turn.speaker: john_g_roberts_jr
turn.label: Chief Justice John G. Roberts, Jr.
turn.text: Thank you, counsel.
The case is submitted.
